key_title: Key to the species of Populus

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Populus
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Populus. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Mature leaves hairy on the lower surface
Lower surface of leaves glabrous or with hairs restricted to veins
Lower surface of leaves densely felted; long-shoot leaves palmatifid
Lower surface of leaves with a thin layer of cobwebbed hair; leaves not palmatifid
Leaves longer than wide; lower surface of leaves distinctly white
Leaf length similar to width, or leaves slightly wider than long; lower surface of leaves pale green or blueish-grey
Leaves suborbicular, blue-grey below; apex rounded or apiculate
Leaves triangular, broadly ovate or deltoid-ovoid, pale green below; apex acuminate
Base of leaves cuneate, often broadly so; glands absent from near base of leaf
Base of leaves truncate or shallowly cordate; usually at least some leaves with a gland on one or both sides of the midvein near the junction of the petiole and lamina
